item.title: Novartis and Microsoft join forces to develop drugs using AI
item.description: I led a team to create a Microsoft Research partnership with Novartis Cell & Gene therapy, which was a key component of a broader Microsoft-Novartis partnership.

item.title: Microsoft makes splash in AI-enabled lab solutions
item.description: I led a team to develop the Station B platform and to establish research partnerships with Princeton University and Oxford Biomedica.

item.title: Researchers build nanoscale distributed DNA computing systems from artificial protocells
Programming biology with Dr. Andrew Phillips
item.description: What if we could figure out exactly how the building blocks of life work and harness their power with the rigor and predictability of computer science?

item.title: Microsoft moves into biological computing with Station B
item.description: I led a team to create and launch the Station B initiative at Microsoft Research, with the aim of developing a platform for programming biological systems.

item.title: Microsoft’s “Biological Computing” Lab Aims To Fight Diseases By Reprogramming Cells
item.description: I led a team to establish the first molecular biology lab at Microsoft.

item.title: Microsoft: Productivity Future Vision
item.description: I proposed the biotechnology concept for a Microsoft Office Envisioning video, on a future version of Office that enables programming yeast cells to biomanufacture therapeutics, and was a consultant for the production team. 2M views.

item.title: Computing with soup
item.description: I led a team to develop a programming language for DNA circuits, which featured in a broader article on molecular computing.

item.title: Coming Soon to a Lab Near You: Drag-and-Drop Virtual Worlds
item.description: I led a team to develop software for designing molecular and genetic circuits, featured in a broader article about the Computational Science Lab at Microsoft Research, led by Stephen Emmott.

item.title: Steering the future of computing
item.description: Co-editor and contributing author of the 2020 Science report, led by Stephen Emmott. According to Nature, "That report inspired this week’s focus on computing in Nature", including the cover.
